content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <rdf:RDF   xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/"   xmlns:documentcontainer="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/portal_types/documentContainer#"   xmlns:file="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/portal_types/File#"   xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" >   <documentcontainer:documentContainer rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b">     <dcterms:hasPart>       <file:File rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b/post-chernobyl-surveys-in-gb-metadata">         <file:id xml:lang="en">post-chernobyl-surveys-in-gb-metadata</file:id>         <dcterms:creator>clamw</dcterms:creator>         <dcterms:title xml:lang="en">Supporting documentation</dcterms:title>         <dcterms:created rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2014-09-12T08:46:34Z</dcterms:created>         <dcterms:isPartOf rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b"/>         <dcterms:modified rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2014-10-06T15:46:11Z</dcterms:modified>       </file:File>     </dcterms:hasPart>     <dcterms:creator>clamw</dcterms:creator>     <dcterms:title xml:lang="en">Post Chernobyl surveys of radiocaesium in soil, vegetation, wildlife and fungi in Great Britain</dcterms:title>     <dcterms:created rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2014-06-17T08:15:13Z</dcterms:created>     <dcterms:isPartOf rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata"/>     <dcterms:description xml:lang="en">Data comprise radiocaesium concentrations in soil, vegetation, wildlife and fungi analysed from samples collected from throughout Great Britain after the 1986 Chernobyl accident by the Centre for Ecology and Hydrology (CEH), formerly the Institute of Terrestrial Ecology (ITE). National level vegetation surveys were conducted in May 1986, October 1986 and Spring 1987. More intensive surveys of vegetation (grass and heather) and wildlife (grouse, fox, etc.) in restricted areas were carried out in Cumbria, Wales and North Yorkshire in 1989, 1990, 1991 and 1993. Surveys of fungi were carried out between 1994 and 1997. The data are suitable for interpolation to create spatially variable surfaces suitable for input into models.</dcterms:description>     <documentcontainer:catalogLink>http://data.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b</documentcontainer:catalogLink>     <documentcontainer:id xml:lang="en">7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b</documentcontainer:id>     <documentcontainer:fileIdentifier xml:lang="en">7a5cfd3e-0247-4228-873d-5be563c4ee3b</documentcontainer:fileIdentifier>     <dcterms:issued rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2014-09-25T09:02:58Z</dcterms:issued>     <dcterms:modified rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2014-10-06T15:53:23Z</dcterms:modified>     <dcterms:subject>STAR_NOE</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>wildlife</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>North Wales</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>UK</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>soil</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>Yorkshire</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>Radioecology</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>grass</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>fungi</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>radioactive</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>radiocaesium</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>Pollution & Environmental Risk</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>radionuclide</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>accident</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>grasses</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>contamination</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>NERC_DDC</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>GB</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>Chernobyl</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>vegetation</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>deposition</dcterms:subject>     <dcterms:subject>heather</dcterms:subject>   </documentcontainer:documentContainer> </rdf:RDF>
